pr_title: docs: add instructions on how to use locally created docker images

timeline.message: docs: add instructions on how to use locally created docker images

timeline.bodyText: can we avoid this step by having people just use the ksqldb-docker image in their compose files? that was part of the point of consolidating the image
timeline.author: agavra
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -26,3 +27,14 @@ To build a new image with local changes:
     ```
     placeholder/confluentinc/ksqldb-docker       local.build   94210cd14384   About an hour ago   716MB
     ```
+   
+1. To use with the `docker-compose.yml` file in the root of the project, run the following additional commands to create

replies.bodyText: It's not their docker file - it's the one in the root of the project, and it needs to work with published images, which currently have two names.
replies.author: big-andy-coates
